</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	subsidiary. This transaction also resulted in taxable loss for our Luxemburg subsidiary and this tax benefit was offset by an increase in the change in valuation allowance. In connection with the
	waiver of unpaid interest, the related withholding tax was reversed, resulting in the recognition of income tax benefit of $17.8 million as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The statutory income tax rate of the Company&#146;s Korean subsidiary was approximately 24.2% in 2016, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">

	this difference are as follows (in thousands):

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The permanent differences above include non-taxable TPECs and interest income from other financial
	instruments for US tax purposes and non-deductible interest expense according to the thin capitalization rule for Korean tax purposes. The permanent impairment of $62,334 thousand in 2015 was related to the loss recognized by the Company&#146;s
	Luxemburg subsidiary in connection with the cancellation of debt as described above, which was not recognized for US tax purposes.
</FONT>

</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The valuation allowances at December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014 are primarily attributable to deferred
	tax assets for the uncertainty in taxable income at the Company&#146;s Korean subsidiary. The Company has recorded a full valuation allowance against the deferred tax assets, net of its deferred tax liabilities, and against certain foreign
	subsidiary&#146;s deferred tax assets pertaining to its related tax loss carry-forwards that are not anticipated to generate a tax benefit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	109
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The amount presented as &#147;Charged to expense&#148; primarily relates to the utilization of net
	operating loss and tax credit carry-forwards, or pre-tax losses for which there is no tax benefit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The evaluation of the
	recoverability of the deferred tax asset and the need for a valuation allowance requires the Company to weigh all positive and negative evidence to reach a conclusion that it is more likely than not that all or some portion of the deferred tax asset
	will not be realized. The weight given to the evidence is commensurate with the extent to which it can be objectively verified. The more negative evidence that exists, the more positive evidence is necessary and the more difficult it is to support a
	conclusion that a valuation allowance is not needed. Realization of the future tax benefits related to the deferred tax assets is dependent on many factors, including the Company&#146;s ability to generate future taxable income within the period
	during which the temporary differences reverse, the outlook for the economic environment in which the Company operates and the overall future industry outlook.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, the Company had net deferred tax assets of $183 thousand, $171&nbsp;thousand and $577 thousand, respectively, related to the Company&#146;s Japanese
	subsidiary. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, the Company recorded a valuation allowance of $281,473 thousand, $279,867 thousand and $194,739 thousand on its deferred tax assets related to temporary differences, net operating loss
	carry-forwards and tax credits of domestic and foreign subsidiaries. The Company recorded these valuation allowances on deferred tax assets based on its assessment that the negative evidence of expected losses in early future years outweighs the
	positive evidence of historical income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, the Company had approximately $684,851 thousand of net
	operating loss carry-forwards available to offset future taxable income, of which $280,417 thousand is associated with the Company&#146;s Korean subsidiary, which expires in part at various dates through 2026. The net operating loss of $268,959
	thousand associated with the Company&#146;s Luxembourg subsidiary is mainly attributable to certain expenses incurred in connection with its shareholding in the Company&#146;s Dutch subsidiary. Although this net operating loss amount is the carried
	forward indefinitely, it will be recaptured on future capital gain. The remaining net operating loss mainly relates to the US parent company and its domestic subsidiary, which expires in part at various dates through 2036. The Company utilized net
	operating loss of $279 thousand, $121 thousand and $1,219 thousand, for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The Company also has Korean, Dutch and U.S. tax credit carry-forwards of approximately $6,738 thousand,
	$13,121 thousand and $390&nbsp;thousand, respectively, as of December&nbsp;31, 2016. The Korean tax credits expire at various dates starting from 2017 to 2021, and the Dutch tax credits are carried forward to be used for an indefinite period of
	time.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	110
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage113"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D298174D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	MAGNACHIP SEMICONDUCTOR CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(CONTINUED)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	(TABULAR DOLLARS IN THOUSANDS, EXCEPT SHARE DATA)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Uncertainty in Income Taxes
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company and its subsidiaries file income tax returns in Korea, Japan, Taiwan, the U.S.&nbsp;and in various other jurisdictions. The
	Company is subject to income tax examinations by tax authorities of these jurisdictions for all open tax years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of
	December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, the Company recorded $2,459 thousand, $2,139 thousand and $3,491 thousand of liabilities for unrecognized tax benefits, respectively. For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015and 2014, the Company
	recorded $670 thousand, $1,606 thousand and $110 thousand of income tax benefits, respectively, by reversing liabilities due to the lapse of the applicable statute of limitations and incurred $687 thousand, $351 thousand and $44 thousand of income
	tax expenses, respectively, for uncertain tax positions mainly resulting from imputed interest related to intercompany balances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, the Company recognized $334 thousand, $45 thousand, $10 thousand of interest and penalties, respectively, related to unrecognized tax benefits as
	a component of income tax expense. Total interest and penalties accrued as of December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014 were $691 thousand, $359 thousand and $480 thousand, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company is currently unaware of any uncertain tax positions that could result in significant additional payments, accruals, or other
	material deviation in this estimate over the next 12 months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	A tabular reconciliation of the total amounts of unrecognized
	tax benefits at the beginning and end of each period is as follows (in thousands):
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	17. Geographic and Segment Information
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company had previously reported its results of operations under one operating segment. During the second quarter of 2015, organizational changes were made to (i)&nbsp;realign the Company&#146;s
	businesses and organizational structure and (ii)&nbsp;streamline and consolidate certain business processes to achieve greater operating efficiencies. In furtherance of these objectives, the Company combined its Display Solutions and Power Solutions
	business lines into a new segment called Standard Products Group. Beginning in the second quarter of 2015, the Company began reporting its financial results in two operating segments: Semiconductor Manufacturing Services and Standard Products Group.
	During the third quarter of 2015, the Company changed the name of its Semiconductor Manufacturing Services segment to Foundry Services Group. The Company&#146;s chief operating decision maker is its Chief Executive Officer who allocates resources
	and assesses performance of the business and other activities based on gross profit. The two newly established operating segments were managed prospectively and all prior period amounts related to the segment change have been retrospectively
	reclassified to conform to the new presentation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	111
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net sales from the Company&#146;s top ten largest customers accounted for 64%, 64% and 61% for the years
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, the Company had two
	customers that represented 23.5% and 11.4% of its net sales, respectively. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company had two customers that represented 15.2% and 11.0% of its net sales, respectively. For the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2014, the Company had two customers that represented 11.4% and 10.7% of its net sales, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	96% of the
	Company&#146;s property, plant and equipment are located in Korea as of December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	18. Commitments and Contingencies
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Operating Agreements with SK Hynix
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In connection with the
	acquisition of the non-memory semiconductor business from&nbsp;SK Hynix on October&nbsp;4, 2004 (the &#147;Original Acquisition&#148;), the Company entered into several agreements with SK Hynix, including a non-exclusive cross license that provides
	the Company with access to certain of SK Hynix&#146;s intellectual property for use in the manufacture and sale of non-memory semiconductor products. The Company also agreed to provide certain utilities and infrastructure support services to SK
	Hynix.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Upon the closing of the Original Acquisition, the Company&#146;s Korean subsidiary and SK Hynix also entered into
	lease agreements under which the Company&#146;s Korean subsidiary leases space to SK Hynix in several buildings, primarily warehouses and utility facilities, in Cheongju, Korea. These leases are generally for an initial term of 20&nbsp;years plus an
	indefinite number of renewal terms of 10&nbsp;years each. Each of the leases is cancelable upon 90&nbsp;days&#146; notice by the lessee. The Company also leases certain land from SK Hynix located in Cheongju, Korea. The term of this lease is
	indefinite unless otherwise agreed by the parties, and as long as the buildings remain on the lease site and are owned and used by the Company for permitted uses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Operating Leases
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company leases land, office space and
	equipment under various operating lease agreements with various terms. Rental expenses were approximately $8,898 thousand, $8,194 thousand and $9,421 thousand for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, the minimum aggregate rental payments due under non-cancelable lease contracts are as follows (in
	thousands):
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Securities Class Action Complaints
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company recorded the $23,500 thousand of the settlement obligation for the Class Action Litigation as accrued expenses in the consolidated balance sheets as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and as selling,
	general and administrative expenses in the consolidated statements of operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. For further information regarding the Class Action Litigation, see &#147;Item 3. Legal Proceedings&#148; included elsewhere
	in this Report. The Company recorded $29,571 thousand of the proceeds from the insurers as other receivables in the consolidated balance sheets as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and as a deduction of the selling, general and administrative expenses in
	the consolidated statements of operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The proceeds from the insurers of $29,571 thousand were deposited into the Company&#146;s escrow account during the first quarter of 2016 and the Company
	reclassified the $29,571 thousand deposits recorded in other receivables into restricted cash. During the third quarter of 2016, the Company disbursed the aggregate settlement payment
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	113
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage116"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D298174D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	MAGNACHIP SEMICONDUCTOR CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(CONTINUED)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	(TABULAR DOLLARS IN THOUSANDS, EXCEPT SHARE DATA)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	of $23,500 thousand after the court granted plaintiffs&#146; renewed motion for preliminary approval of the settlement in July 2016. Upon the settlement payment, $6,114 thousand of the insurance
	proceeds remained in the Company&#146;s escrow account. For subsequent treatment of the escrow amount, see &#147;
<I>
	Shareholder Derivative Complaints
</I>
	&#148; below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	SEC Enforcement Staff Review
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In March 2014, the Company voluntarily
	reported to the SEC that the Company&#146;s Audit Committee (the &#147;Audit Committee&#148;) had determined that the Company incorrectly recognized revenue on certain transactions and as a result would restate its financial statements, and that the
	Audit Committee had commenced an independent investigation. Over the course of 2014 and the first two quarters of 2015, the Company voluntarily produced documents to the SEC regarding the various accounting issues identified during the independent
	investigation, and whether the Company&#146;s hiring of an accountant from the Company&#146;s independent registered public accounting firm impacted that accounting firm&#146;s independence. On July&nbsp;22, 2014, the Staff of the SEC&#146;s
	Division of Enforcement obtained a Formal Order of Investigation. On March&nbsp;12, 2015, the SEC issued a subpoena for documents to the Company in connection with its investigation. The Company will continue to cooperate with the SEC in this
	investigation, and has produced documents in response to the subpoena. At this time, the Company is unable to estimate any reasonably possible loss, or range of reasonably possible losses, with respect to the matters described above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Shareholder Derivative Complaints
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The settlement for the shareholder derivative actions described in &#147;Item 3. Legal Proceedings&#148; provided for an aggregate payment from the Company defendants&#146; directors and officers
	insurance policies of $3,000&nbsp;thousand to be made to an escrow account, which will be payable to the Company (less certain deductions and applicable interest) once the settlement becomes effective. For further information regarding the
	shareholder derivative actions, see &#147;Item&nbsp;3. Legal Proceedings&#148; included elsewhere in this Report. The $3,000 thousand settlement payment was included in the insurance proceeds of $29,571 thousand as discussed in &#147;
<I>
	Securities
	Class Action Complaints
</I>
	&#148; above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On June&nbsp;10, 2016, the court granted plaintiffs&#146; motion for preliminary
	approval of the proposed settlement. On October&nbsp;18, 2016, after a hearing held on October&nbsp;14, 2016, the court entered its order and final judgment (the &#147;Judgment&#148;) granting final approval of the proposed settlement and awarding
	plaintiffs&#146; counsel $750 thousand for attorneys&#146; fees and litigation expenses. As a result, $750 thousand was paid out of the Company&#146;s escrow account. The Judgment was not appealed within the applicable appeals period (on or before
	December&nbsp;19, 2016). The settlement therefore became effective after the expiration of the appeals period and $2,258 thousand was paid to the Company from the escrow account, previously recorded as restricted cash, in December 2016. The
	remaining restricted cash related to insurance proceeds of $3,078 thousand was also released in December 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	19. Related Party
	Transactions
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

<I>
	Stockholders
</I>
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Funds affiliated with Avenue Capital Management II, L.P. (&#147;Avenue&#148;) owned 11.7% of the Company&#146;s common stock issued and outstanding at December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Funds affiliated with Engaged Capital, LLC. owned 11.0% of the Company&#146;s common stock issued and outstanding at December&nbsp;31,

<TD WIDTH="61%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="3%">
</TD>
<TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Rights Plan
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On March&nbsp;5, 2015, the Company entered into a Rights Agreement, dated as of March&nbsp;5, 2015 between the Company and American Stock Transfer&nbsp;&amp; Trust Company, LLC, as rights agent (as
	amended, the &#147;Rights Agreement&#148;), and the Board of Directors of the Company authorized and declared a dividend of one preferred stock purchase right (a &#147;Right&#148; and collectively, the &#147;Rights&#148;) for each share of the
	Company&#146;s common stock, par value $0.01 per share, outstanding at the close of business on March&nbsp;16, 2015. The Company amended the Rights Agreement on March&nbsp;2, 2016 and September&nbsp;2, 2016. As amended, each Right, once exercisable,
	will entitle the registered holder to purchase from the Company one one-thousandth of a share of Series A Junior Participating Preferred Stock, par value $0.01 per share, at a purchase price of $12, subject to adjustment (the &#147;Purchase
	Price&#148;). The Rights are not presently exercisable and remain attached to the shares of common stock unless and until the occurrence of the earlier of the following (the &#147;Distribution Date&#148;): (i)&nbsp;the tenth day after the public
	announcement or disclosure by the Company or any person or group of affiliated or associated persons that any person or group of affiliated or associated persons has become an &#147;Acquiring Person&#148; by obtaining beneficial ownership of 12.5%
	(or 20% in the case of a &#147;passive institutional investor,&#148; which is defined generally as any person who has reported beneficial ownership of shares of common stock on Schedule 13G under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934) or more of the
	Company&#146;s outstanding common stock, subject to certain exceptions; or (ii)&nbsp;the tenth business day (or such later date as the Company&#146;s Board of Directors may designate before a person or group of affiliated or associated persons
	becomes an Acquiring Person) after the commencement of, or first public announcement of the intent of any person to commence, a tender or exchange offer by any person or group of affiliated or associated persons, which would, if consummated, result
	in such person or group becoming an Acquiring Person. The Board of Directors may redeem all of the Rights for $0.001 per Right at any time before any person or group of affiliated or associated persons becomes an Acquiring Person. In addition, at
	any time on or after any person or group of affiliated or associated persons becomes an Acquiring Person (but before any person or group of affiliated or associated persons becomes the owner of 50% or more of the Company&#146;s outstanding common
	stock), the Board of Directors may exchange all or part of the
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	116
</FONT>
</P>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D298174D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	MAGNACHIP SEMICONDUCTOR CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(CONTINUED)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	(TABULAR DOLLARS IN THOUSANDS, EXCEPT SHARE DATA)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Rights (other than the Rights beneficially owned by the Acquiring Person and certain affiliated persons) for shares of common stock at an exchange ratio of one share of common stock per Right.
	The Rights will expire at the close of business on March&nbsp;5, 2017, unless redeemed or exchanged prior to that time.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	If
	any person or group of affiliated or associated persons becomes an Acquiring Person, then, after the Distribution Date, each Right (other than Rights beneficially owned by the Acquiring Person and certain affiliated persons or transferees thereof)
	will entitle the holder to purchase, for the Purchase Price, a number of shares of common stock having a market value of twice the Purchase Price. Alternatively, if, after any person or group of affiliated or associated persons becomes an Acquiring
	Person, (1)&nbsp;the Company is involved in a merger or other business combination in which the Company is not the surviving corporation or its common stock is changed into or exchanged for other securities or assets; or (2)&nbsp;the Company or one
	or more of its subsidiaries sell or otherwise transfer assets or earning power aggregating more than 50% of the assets or earning power of the Company and its subsidiaries, taken as a whole, then each Right will entitle the holder to purchase, for
	the Purchase Price, a number of shares of common stock of the other party to such business combination or sale (or in certain circumstances, an affiliate) having a market value of twice the Purchase Price.
</FONT>
</P>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	MAGNACHIP SEMICONDUCTOR CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(CONTINUED)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	(TABULAR DOLLARS IN THOUSANDS, EXCEPT SHARE DATA)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	23. Subsequent Events
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Derivative Contracts
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On January&nbsp;4, 2017, the Company and the
	counterparty, the Nomura Financial Investment (Korea) Co., Ltd., entered into derivative contracts of zero cost collars for the period from March 2017 to June 2017. The total notional amounts are $82,000 thousand. In connection with the contracts,
	the Company paid $3,800 thousand of cash deposits to the counterparty in January 2017.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Stock Repurchase
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On January&nbsp;11, 2017, the Company repurchased 1,795,444 shares of its common stock in the open market under the
	Company&#146;s stock repurchase programs, which was authorized by its board of directors on January&nbsp;10, 2017, at an aggregate cost of $11,401 thousand.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Issuance of Exchangeable Senior Notes
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As disclosed in the
	Company&#146;s Form 8-K filed on January&nbsp;17, 2017, MagnaChip Semiconductor S.A., the Company&#146;s Luxembourg subsidiary, closed an offering of 5.00% Exchangeable Senior Notes due 2021 with an $86,250 thousand aggregate principal
	amount.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	118
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage121"></A>

<EFX_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES>
<A NAME="FIS_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D298174D10K_HTM_TOC298174_14">
</A>
	Item&nbsp;9. Changes in and Disagreements with Accountants on Accounting and
	Financial Disclosure
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	None.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES>
<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D298174D10K_HTM_TOC298174_15">
</A>
	Item&nbsp;9A. Controls and Procedures
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	(a) Evaluation of
	Disclosure Controls and Procedures
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We maintain disclosure controls and procedures that are designed to ensure that
	information required to be disclosed in our periodic reports filed or submitted under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (&#147;Exchange Act&#148;), is recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the time periods specified in
	the SEC&#146;s rules and forms, and that such information is accumulated and communicated to our management, including our Chief Executive Officer (&#147;Principal Executive Officer&#148;) and Chief Financial Officer (&#147;Principal Financial
	Officer&#148;), as appropriate, to allow for timely decisions regarding required disclosure.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Management of the Company, with
	the participation of our Principal Executive Officer and our Principal Financial Officer, conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness of the design and operation of our disclosure controls and procedures, as such term is defined under Rules
	13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e) promulgated under the Exchange Act, as of December&nbsp;31, 2016. Based on this evaluation, our Principal Executive Officer and our Principal Financial Officer have concluded that our disclosure controls and procedures were
	effective as of December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	(b) Management&#146;s Annual Report on Internal Control Over Financial Reporting
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our management is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting, as
	such term is defined in Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f) under the Exchange Act. Our internal control over financial reporting is a process designed under the supervision of our Principal Executive Officer and our Principal Financial Officer, and
	effected by our Board, management and other personnel, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted
	accounting principles.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Because of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or
	detect misstatements. Also, projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future periods are subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with policies or procedures
	may deteriorate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Under the supervision and with the participation of our Principal Executive Officer and our Principal
	Financial Officer, we conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness of the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2016, based on the criteria set forth in
<I>
	Internal Control&#151;Integrated Framework
</I>
	(2013)&nbsp;issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (&#147;COSO&#148;). Based on our assessment, we concluded that our internal control over financial reporting was effective as of December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The effectiveness of the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 has been
	audited by Samil PricewaterhouseCoopers, an independent registered public accounting firm, as stated in their report which appears in Item&nbsp;8 of this Annual Report on Form 10-K.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	(c) Remediation of Prior Year Material Weaknesses
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Rule 12b-2 under
	the Exchange Act of 1934, and Rule 1-02 of Regulation S-X defines a &#147;material weakness&#148; as a deficiency, or a combination of deficiencies, in internal control over financial reporting, such that there is a reasonable possibility that a
	material misstatement of the registrant&#146;s annual or interim financial statements will not be prevented or detected on a timely basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	119
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage122"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D298174D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As previously disclosed in Part II, Item&nbsp;9A of the 2015 Form 10-K, we identified
	material weaknesses in our internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 as described below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Period End
	Closing and Financial Reporting:
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we did not operate effective period end closing and
	financial reporting controls over the completeness and accuracy of our non-routine manual journal entries. Specifically, controls over the analysis, documentation, review and approval of the non-routine manual journal entries were not operated
	effectively as designed to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the entries recorded.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	During 2015, although we had
	implemented our internal controls in the period-end closing and financial reporting process to: (i)&nbsp;require appropriate internal and external evidence to be prepared for certain types of routine journal entries; (ii)&nbsp;improve the methods of
	reconciliation, confirmation, verification, observation, period end cut-off test, and analysis of each account in a timely manner; and (iii)&nbsp;assign appropriate roles and responsibilities for more comprehensive review procedures, including the
	involvement of finance and operational managers, in order to strengthen controls over the completeness and accuracy of manual journal entries, material weaknesses in our period end closing and financial reporting controls over non-routine manual
	journal entries described above were not remediated as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, because controls over the completeness and accuracy of non-routine manual journal entries did not operate effectively for a sufficient period of time.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, we concluded, through testing of the operating effectiveness of our implemented controls related to
	period-end closing and financial reporting, that the material weakness has been fully remediated.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Income Tax Accounting and
	Disclosures:
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we did not operate an effective control over the completeness and accuracy
	of our income tax accounting and disclosures. Specifically, the control over the analysis and review of current income taxes was not operated effectively as designed to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the entries recorded.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	During 2015, although we had implemented our procedures and controls over tax accounting and reporting by ensuring that we, on a timely
	basis: (i)&nbsp;review rules and regulations of tax jurisdictions relevant to each of our consolidated entities; (ii)&nbsp;review related accounting implications with respect to current income taxes, deferred income taxes, uncertain tax positions
	and related disclosures; and (iii)&nbsp;improve the competency of our accounting employees through ongoing training on income tax accounting, disclosure practices, and rules and regulations, material weakness in our control over income tax
	accounting and disclosures described above was not considered remediated as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, because controls over the analysis and review of current income taxes did not operate effectively for a sufficient period of time.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, we concluded, through testing of the operating effectiveness of our implemented controls related to income
	tax accounting and disclosures, that the material weakness has been fully remediated.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	(d) Changes in Internal Control Over Financial
	Reporting
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	There were no changes in internal control over financial reporting during the quarter ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2016 that have materially affected, or are reasonably likely to materially affect, our internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.1
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">

</FONT>

<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Second Amended Chapter 11 Plan of Reorganization Proposed by the Official Committee of Unsecured Creditors of MagnaChip Semiconductor Finance Company, et al., dated as of
	September&nbsp;24, 2009 (incorporated by reference to Exhibit 2.1 to our Amendment No.&nbsp;1 to Registration Statement on Form&nbsp;S-1 filed on April&nbsp;20, 2010 (Registration No.&nbsp;333-165467)).

</FONT>
</TD>

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Certificate of Conversion of MagnaChip Semiconductor LLC (incorporated by reference to Exhibit&nbsp;3.1 to our Current Report on Form 8-K filed on March&nbsp;11,
	2011).
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" NOWRAP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.2
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">

<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(1)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

</P>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;

	109

	&nbsp;&nbsp;

	Form of Note
